intro: Moehringia tejedensis, commonly known as the Tejeda moehringia, is a flowering plant belonging to the Montiaceae family. It is native to the Iberian Peninsula, specifically found in the Sierra de Tejeda region of southern Spain. This species is characterized by its compact, cushion-like growth habit and small, lance-shaped leaves. The flowers are typically pink to purple in color, with five petals and are borne in dense clusters. It thrives in rocky, arid environments and is adapted to withstand drought and high levels of sunlight.
